text: Patsy Lynch (born July 21, 1953) is an American photographer. Her work documents GLBT civil rights advocacy. ==Life== Lynch grew up in Washington, D.C. She graduated from Elon University, where she was co-editor of the college newspaper,"Elon College Revives Paper," Burlington Times-News(October 16, 1974): 14. via Newspapers.com and from Gallaudet University. She has covered such events as the 1979 National March on Washington for Lesbian and Gay Rights, and the 1988 Deaf President Now protests at Gallaudet.Jack R. Gannon, The Week the World Heard Gallaudet (Gallaudet University Press 1989): 77. ISBN Her LGBT advocacy includes being a founding member of the Washington, D.C., chapter of the National Lesbian and Gay Journalists Association, as well as covering the White House, the first openly gay journalist to do so. Her photography appeared in a 2007 exhibit called "Community Pioneers", of which she said: Her work is in the collection of the Smithsonian Museum of American History.National Museum of American History Collects History Related to Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender History at Smithsonian Institution site, August 19, 2014 ==Awards and recognition== * 2006 GLAA Awardee of Distinguished Service Award.Distinguished Service Award to Patsy Lynch at glaa.org ==References== ==External links== *http://www.patsylynchphotography.com/ *http://lgbthistorymonth.com/patsy- lynch *http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/c85b00vq/ *http://itsaqueerworld.blogspot.com/2010/10/patsy-lynch-photographer.html *http://ohmygodot.blogspot.com/2010/10/out-spotlight_10.html Category:Living people Category:American women photographers Category:1953 births Category:Elon University alumni Category:Gallaudet University alumni Category:20th-century American photographers Category:20th-century American women artists Category:21st-century American photographers Category:21st- century American women artists Category:Photographers from Washington, D.C. title: Patsy Lynch
